meanings.sent1: The people will reelect their leader next year.
meanings.sent2: I will reelect the same president for another term.
meanings.sent3: It seems like the town will reelect the mayor's cat as the official mascot.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to reelect its rays upon the calm sea.
meanings.sent5: The students decided to reelect their favorite teacher with a standing ovation.

meanings.definition: To choose for a position again.
meanings.sent1: The committee will reelect the current chairman for another term.
meanings.sent2: I plan to reelect my best friend as the class representative.
meanings.sent3: The company might reelect the office plant as the employee of the month.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to reelect the fallen leaves back onto the tree.
meanings.sent5: The team unanimously decided to reelect their coach for the upcoming season.
